feed.title: SAP Community - Document Information Extraction
feed.subtitle: Document Information Extraction Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Challenges with Field Extraction in Indian Invoices Using Document Information Extraction
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently working on extracting fields from over 100 different templates of Indian invoices using the SAP Document Information Extraction service. However, I am facing challenges in obtaining accurate results across multiple scenarios.

Here are the two approaches I have tried:

Scenario 1:

  • I modified the default SAP invoice schema and added custom fields such as CGST, SGST, IGST (header fields), and HSN, batch number and so on (line items).
  • I created templates for each vendor/different invoice template and trained them using 2-3 sample invoices.

Issues Encountered:

  • Extra line items below the table are being captured as there is no way to declare a footer for the table.
  • Custom fields like CGST rate, CGST value, and HSN are not extracted properly in most cases, especially when there is even a slight difference between the trained template and the input invoice.

Scenario 2:

  • I chose a custom schema and created a list of fields that I needed, such as vendor name, vendor GST, PO number, invoice number and date, CGST, SGST, freight, packaging & forwarding, with the setup type as “auto” for all fields.

Few examples of Issues Encountered:

  • CGST is getting captured even when IGST is present on the invoice.
  • The vendor GST number is being captured as the receiver GST number.
  • Delivery note numbers are being captured as invoice numbers, and material codes are being captured as HSN codes in line items.

When I try to create templates for each invoice under the custom schema and train them, I observe even worse results than before (untrained).

Could anyone help with tackling these issues or suggest a better approach to achieve more accurate results in field extraction?

Thank you!

Best regards,
Koushik

entry.title: Re: SAP Build process Automation - Document Extraction Se...
entry.content:
Hi Julian,

The issue you're facing is likely due to the region selected during the creation of your sub-account. The Document Information Extraction Service is only available in specific regions: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt) EU Access, Japan (Tokyo), and US East (VA).

If your sub-account was created in a region outside of these supported regions, the service won’t appear when you're trying to use it within the SAP Build Process Automation Service. This is why the "Document Template" and "Extract Data" activities aren't available in your workflow.

To resolve this issue, you may want to check the region where your sub-account is hosted. If it's in an unsupported region, you could create a new sub-account in one of the supported regions and try using the Document Information Extraction Service there.

I hope this helps!

Best regards,
Koushik

entry.title: How to use Document Information Extraction with CAPM (Node.js)?
MDG document storeage
entry.content:

I have a question regarding documents on the change request.
Where are the documents physically stored in SAP? The table USMD1211 shows for which change request there are documents, but not where they are stored in the SAP memory. Is there a way to download the documents in bulk?

Regards

While extracting data from document, we could see that word by word is being extracted but how can we get which page data is that and also if there is a table or image, how can we understand that it is from table, or it is an image. For now, we can only see the bbox.Please help me in this.

Regards,
Keerthana

entry.title: Creating Custom Client IDs in SAP Document Information Extraction Trial Version
entry.content:
I'm currently working on a requirement using the trial version of the SAP Document Information Extraction service through Postman. While extracting data, I noticed that I'm only getting the default client ID, but I need to create a custom client ID for my custom documents. Is there any way to achieve this with the trial version of SAP, or is there another method I can use?

To provide some context, I have set up my SAP BTP trial account and subscribed to the Document Information Extraction service. I navigated to the SAP BTP Cockpit, created a new service instance, and generated the service keys, which included the client ID and client secret required for authentication. I configured custom documents by specifying the document types and extraction rules in my service instance. Using the generated client ID and client secret in my Postman requests, I was able to authenticate and extract data from my custom documents. However, I'm still limited to the default client ID.

If anyone has experience with this or knows if it's possible to create a custom client ID with the trial version, or if there's another way to achieve this, I would greatly appreciate your insights. Additionally, if the trial version does not support this feature, would upgrading to a paid version provide the necessary flexibility and additional features to manage custom client IDs more effectively?

entry.title: Calling Document Extraction API from Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are trying to develop the interface in the Integration Suite, which at some moment sends a document for the Document Information Extraction service via the following API:

https://xxx.cfapps.xx.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs

One of the technical difficulties is the fact that Integration Suite doesn't fully support formdata requests.

After some attempts the following response is received:

{"error": {"code": "E30", "message": "Cannot process file of content type.", "details": [{"code": "0", "message": "Content type: None"}]}}

Request has a Content-Type header with the value:

multipart/form-data; boundary=--cpi

Could you please share some experience or tips and tricks to use of the API from the Integration Suite? Or if you have success stories, would be happy to hear that.

 

Thanks a lot!

entry.title: Schema in Document Information Extraction for Create Sales Order - Automatic Extraction (4X9)
entry.content:
I have set up scope item 4X9 Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction in my S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud environment. When uploading the purchase order PDF, there are corrections I would like to make that I have actioned in the Document Information Extraction application on BTP. I have corrected the fields, associated the document with the template, and assigned the template to schema SAP_purchaseOrder_schema.

When I upload the PDF in the Document Information Extraction UI, I can select this schema and the template is applied correctly. 

However, when using the UI in S/4HANA, in this case the "Create Sales Order - Automatic Extraction" fiori app, the document shows up in Document Information Extraction UI but it shows the message

"Schema associated with this document has been deleted."

Is this expected behaviour? Is it possible to associate this app "Create Sales Order - Automatic Extraction" (Scope item 4X9) with a particular schema for Purchase Orders? Or perhaps change the association in Document Information Extraction to use the schema SAP_purchaseOrder_schema when the inbound document is a Purchase Order, which is correctly identified in the header.

The plan I have selected in BTP for Document Information Extraction is the basic plan, not the premium plan.

Any guidance is much appreciated.

entry.title: Search Documents and ECNs that is linked to a Material using a table in SE16N
entry.content:
Hello, I would like to know how to search for Documents (DIRs) and Change Master Record (ECNs) that is linked to a Material using any table in SE16N or database.

I know the basic search transaction 'Find Documents'.

In my case, I have a huge number of MAT numbers. Using this, I need to know what all DIRs and ECNs are linked to them.

If someone could share the info, very much appreciated for your support and knowledge.

entry.title: Reading Vehicle Licence Plate (Vehicle Number Plate) Using Document Information Extraction
entry.content:
I am working on a project where I am using Document Information Extraction technology to extract text from vehicle number plates. This technology helps recognize and pull out the alphanumeric characters (text) displayed on number plates. However, I am facing challenges when it comes to extracting the color of the number plate. While the text extraction is not working properly and the color detection part isn't being detected, and the results are not accurate. I need help to improve this process so that I can reliably capture both the text (numbers and letters) and the color of the number plate from images.

I am looking for advice, suggestions, or best practices that could help resolve this issue and make the system work more efficiently.

Specifically, I want to ensure that both the text and color extraction happen smoothly and accurately in my project.
@tomasz_janasz @MariaGoepfert 

SAP Document AI

entry.title: Document Information Extraction - XML File Support - Error E30
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I am trying to process XML Invoices via SAP Document AI. According to the documentation, filetype XML is supposed to be supported for invoices. When trying to upload XML Files via the Web-UI, an Error-Message is shown, describing "Error: Files of this filetype can not be processed (Code: E30).

After further inspecting the network traffic, HTTP RC 415 - Unsupported Media Type is returned for Content type text/xml.
Can somebody assist here? Already tried multiple different Instances & XML Files. 

Thanks!

entry.title: Detecting Handwritten vs. Digital Docs in SAP CAP + DOX
entry.content: I'm working on a solution using SAP CAP (Cloud Application Programming) with Node.js, integrated with SAP Document Information Extraction (DOX). This project sends documents via API to the DOX service to extract relevant information from files such as invoices and receipts. My requirement here is to check whether the document is handwritten or computer-generated. This distinction could significantly enhance data accuracy and processing logic. If anyone has insights on integrating handwriting detection with SAP DOX or using pre-processing techniques for document classification, I’d love to connect and learn more.

entry.title: Oppt Prioritization score custom Agent in SAP CX AI Toolkit
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to create a custom AI agent for opportunities called Oppt Prioritization score agent. For this i created an AI Tool by giving the following prompt:

You are an opportunity prioritization agent in the SAP CX AI Toolkit for SAP Sales Cloud V2. Analyze all opportunities with Opprtunity.Status with Open status.

Calculate the prioritization score based on the following weighted criteria:
1. Opportunity.Expected_Value (50% weight)
2. Opportunity.Probability (30% weight)
3. Opportunity.Close_Date within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date (20% weight)
Assumptions
4.Opportunity.Probability is assumed to be a percentage (0-100).
5.The Opportunity.Close_Date condition is binary, based on whether it falls within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date, interpreted as future dates for prioritization.

Priotitization Score = 0.5*{Opportunity.Expected_Value} + 0.3*{Opportunity.Probability} + 0.2*{cases}
1 {ifOpportunity.Close_Date is within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date} else
0
end{cases}

Provide a one-sentence explanation per opportunity justifying its ranking and, sorted by Amount (descending). Use a professional tone and avoid technical jargon.
For each opportunity, provide a brief, actionable follow-up recommendation (e.g., “Schedule a discovery call to discuss budget constraints”). Use a concise, professional tone and leverage intelligent Q&A to ensure recommendations are contextually relevant.
Include a summary of recent interactions for each opportunity, generated using the toolkit’s AI summary capabilities. Use a professional tone and ensure recommendations support team collaboration.
Ensure Output Fits Within 5000 Chatacters
Compact Formatting--> Remove unnecessary spaces & line breaks.
Limit Answer Length--> Max 500 Characters per answer, truncate with "..."

I assigned this AI tool to the custom AI Agent.The details (PFA screenshot) which are used are

Expected value = 15000 USD

Probability = 80

Close Date = 25 Jul 2025

The calculation for close date is incorrect, it should be 1, but it is coming as 0. Any suggestions how can i achieve the condition for the close date?
